title: Pistons snap record playoff skid with Game 2 win
content: The Detroit Pistons snapped their NBA-record, 15-game postseason losing streak by beating the New York Knicks 100-94 on Monday.

title: Thibs: Brunson not getting calls like Cunningham
content: The Knicks-Pistons first-round playoff series is even -- and Knicks coach Tom Thibodeau said afterward the free throws need to be as well.

title: Ovechkin nets 1st playoff OT goal, Caps top Habs
content: Washington star forward Alex Ovechkin made some personal history in the Capitals' Game 1 win over the Montreal Canadiens on Monday night, scoring the first playoff overtime goal of his storied career en route to a 3-2 win for the No. 1 seed in the East.

title: Source: Younger Iamaleava to join Nico at UCLA
content: Madden Iamaleava, the younger brother of Nico Iamaleava, is expected to join the former Tennessee quarterback at UCLA, a source said Monday.

title: Sources: UCLA's Aguilar to transfer to Tennessee
content: Quarterback Joey Aguilar, who threw for 6,760 yards and 56 touchdowns the past two years with Appalachian State, plans to transfer to Tennessee after transferring to UCLA in the winter portion of the transfer portal, sources told ESPN's Chris Low Monday.

title: Harrison: Didn't know fans' level of love for Luka
content: Nico Harrison said he underestimated the level to which Mavericks fans cared for Luka Doncic and reiterated the blowback to the trade would've eased if the team had been healthy.

title: NCAA floats rules for direct payments to players
content: The NCAA proposed deleting 153 rules from its handbook, a move that will allow schools to share financial benefits directly with players.

title: Ex-Duke commit Henderson joins Lucas in Miami
content: ESPN 100 senior Shelton Henderson, who decommitted from Duke last week, announced his commitment to Miami on Monday.

title: 'Completely separate and at odds': The divisions and chaos that led to the end of the Luka Doncic era in Dallas
content: Doncic's time in Dallas ended with a shocking trade on Feb. 2, but the beginning of the end dates to the summer of 2023.

title: 'Football is a chess game': How Abdul Carter rose to the top of NFL draft boards amid position change
content: After earning Penn State's famed No. 11 jersey, how has Abdul Carter positioned himself to be a top-5 pick?

title: Marcus Rashford at a crossroads: Can he star at Man United again, or must he leave?
content: Marcus Rashford's options are clear this summer -- fight his way back at Man United, try to join Aston Villa permanently or start somewhere new -- but how he got here depends on whom you ask.

title: Leeds, Burnley win, clinch Premier League return
content: Leeds United and Burnley have been promoted to the Premier League after Scott Parker's side beat third-placed Sheffield United on Monday.

title: Alonso has 'gentleman's agreement' to exit Bayer
content: Bayer Leverkusen's CEO has said the club has a "gentleman's agreement" with Xabi Alonso that means he could take over at Real Madrid or Liverpool.

title: Wrexham edge closer to promotion with key win
content: Wrexham climbed back into the automatic promotion spots in League 1 with a crucial 2-1 win over Blackpool on Monday.

title: Italian soccer pauses as Pope Francis dies at 88
content: Monday's Serie A fixtures have been postponed following the death of Pope Francis, the Italian league has announced.

title: Laureus Awards: Yamal wins breakthrough award
content: Lamine Yamal won the world breakthrough of the year award at the 2025 Laureus World Sports Awards ceremony in Madrid on Monday.

title: Guardiola talks up Man City-Villa as a 'final'
content: Pep Guardiola has branded Manchester City's clash with Aston Villa as "a final" in the race for the Champions League and called on the club's fans to help them against Unai Emery's side.

title: Leicester relegated from PL after loss to Liverpool
content: Leicester City have been condemned to an immediate return to the Championship after their relegation from the Premier League was confirmed with a defeat to Liverpool on Sunday.

title: TAA silent on Madrid links after 'special' winner
content: Liverpool defender Trent Alexander-Arnold remained tight-lipped on his future at Anfield amid continued links to Real Madrid, although he added that Sunday's winner over Leicester City would always be "special."

title: The Champions League race so intense it's sure to last to the Premier League's final day
content: Five Premier League teams are fighting for three undecided Champions League spots, and it promises fireworks the rest of the way from here.

title: Should Trent Alexander-Arnold think twice about leaving Liverpool for Real Madrid?
content: Trent Alexander-Arnold has a big decision to make: sign a new deal at Liverpool this summer or leave for (we think) Real Madrid. Considering recent trends at both teams, he should reconsider joining Los Blancos.

title: A win away from the title, Liverpool coronation begins at Leicester
content: Liverpool's fans were already celebrating the title in the win at Leicester. The team itself will soon join in.

title: Drivers, teams who need a reset after F1's first five races
content: It's been a whirlwind to start the F1 season, five races in six weekends, and these names could use a breather.

title: 'Hello, old friend': Randy Orton delivers surprise RKO on John Cena at Raw
content: A day after winning his record 17th WWE title, John Cena ran into a familiar foe on Monday Night Raw.

title: WrestleMania 41 results: Cena makes history, beats Rhodes for WWE Undisputed title
content: The next chapter of John Cena's farewell tour kicks off with the WWE Universal championship around his waist.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Is Charlotte a threat to league's best?
content: After beating impressive San Diego, Charlotte is approaching the summit of ESPN's latest MLS Power Rankings.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: KC, Spirit leapfrog Orlando at the top
content: Orlando's first defeat of 2025 cost the Pride, who fell behind KC and Washington in our latest rankings.

title: OU conquers '24 demons, reclaims gymnastics title
content: Fueled by last season's stunning early exit, Oklahoma reclaimed its place atop the college gymnastics world.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United close in on landing Cunha
content: Manchester United are getting closer to signing Wolves forward Matheus Cunha. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: B'luru biker, IAF officer clash snowballs into language row; new video adds twist
content: A road-rage incident in East Bengaluru involving IAF officers Wing Commander Shiladitya Bose and Squadron Leader Madhumita Dutta turned into a language controversy after Bose alleged abuse in Kannada. His viral video sparked outrage, but CCTV footage revealed he assaulted the biker. Police clarified it as a routine road rage case, unrelated to language or regional bias.

title: Man dumped by 9 wives for abusive behaviour kills 10th over theft suspicion
content: In Chhattisgarh's Jashpur district, Dhula Ram fatally assaulted his tenth wife, Basanti Bai, suspecting her of stealing food and clothing from a wedding. He concealed her body in a forest, where it was discovered five days later due to the foul odor.

title: Rahane slams openers after KKR's crushing defeat against GT
content: Kolkata Knight Riders faced a 39-run defeat against Gujarat Titans, with skipper Ajinkya Rahane acknowledging the team's struggles with opening partnerships. Rahane emphasized the need for improved batting, especially in the middle overs, despite the bowlers' consistent performance.

title: The AdTech ruling that made Google send 'Do not Worry' email to employees
content: A US judge ruled that Google holds illegal monopolies in its ad tech business, potentially leading to a breakup of its ad operations. Google plans to appeal, arguing its success stems from superior technology, not anti-competitive behavior.

title: Chilli powder blinded him, 12 stab wounds killed ex-Karnataka DGP Om Prakash
content: Former Karnataka DGP Om Prakash was murdered by his wife Pallavi during lunch at their Bengaluru home. She stabbed him multiple times after an alleged history of domestic violence. Pallavi later confessed via WhatsApp. A property dispute and claims of abuse, drugging, and digital surveillance are being probed. Their daughter Kriti's role remains unclear. Investigation continues.

title: Gensol Engineering under ED scanner over 'links' to Mahadev betting app case
content: The Enforcement Directorate is set to interrogate Gensol Engineering's promoters, Anmol and Puneet Singh Jaggi, amidst a probe into the Mahadev Book app's illegal betting and money laundering activities. The ED has already frozen over 500,000 shares of the company, suspecting stock price manipulation using illicit funds routed through foreign portfolio investors.

title: Infosys to 240 failed trainees: 'As you explore opportunities outside...'
content: Infosys recently terminated 240 entry-level employees after they failed to clear internal assessment tests, following a similar layoff of over 300 trainees in February. Despite additional preparation and multiple attempts, these System Engineers and Digital Specialist Engineers did not meet the required standards.

title: US slaps up to 3,521% duties on Southeast Asian solar imports
content: The United States has imposed significant new duties, up to 3,521%, on solar imports from Cambodia, Vietnam, Malaysia, and Thailand, responding to claims of unfair subsidies and below-cost sales. While supporting domestic manufacturers like Hanwha Q Cells and First Solar, these duties create challenges for US renewable energy developers reliant on affordable foreign supplies.

title: 'Saudi Arabia a valued partner of India': PM Modi ahead of his visit
content: Prime Minister Modi, ahead of his Saudi Arabia visit, lauded the Kingdom as a trusted friend and strategic ally with limitless potential for India. He praised Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman's visionary leadership and highlighted the strong bilateral ties since 2014.

title: George Soros' son wishes Happy Easter, Elon Musk responds: You ...
content: A brief exchange on X between Alex Soros and Elon Musk has sparked intrigue, given their families' history of public disagreements. It began when Alex Soros shared Easter greetings, to which Musk responded with, “Um … you too”.

title: Why women can't become a Pope? Explained
content: Pope Francis's death on Easter Monday has prompted a global response, with Cardinal Kevin Ferrell announcing his passing. Cardinals will gather in the Sistine Chapel to elect a successor, adhering to specific protocols. Candidates must be baptized Catholic males, at least 35 years old, and educated in Biblical studies, theology, or canon law, reflecting the Church's male-only priesthood tradition.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex sees choppy start; Nifty50 near 24,100
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, saw a choppy start to trade on Tuesday morning. Dr. VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Investments says that this period of uncertainty is likely to witness EMs like India decoupling from the US market.

title: ED issues notice to Actor Mahesh Babu in money laundering case
content: Telugu superstar Mahesh Babu has been served a notice by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) concerning a money laundering investigation involving real estate firms Sai Surya Developers and the Surana Group. The probe focuses on alleged fraudulent practices, with Babu reportedly receiving Rs 5.9 crore for endorsing projects linked to the developers. The ED suspects that Rs 2.

title: Anaya Bangar meets her best friend Sarfaraz Khan after three years
content: Anaya Bangar, daughter of Sanjay Bangar, reunited with her childhood friend Sarfaraz Khan after her gender affirmation surgery. Sarfaraz expressed his excitement about meeting Anaya after three years. Anaya revealed she faced harassment within the cricket world, including receiving unsolicited nude photos from cricketers and a proposition from a veteran player.

title: PM Modi to visit Saudi Arabia today - What’s on the agenda
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to arrive in Jeddah for a two-day official visit to Saudi Arabia, his first to the Kingdom's commercial capital, at the invitation of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman. They will co-chair the India-Saudi Arabia Strategic Partnership Council meeting, focusing on strengthening economic and defence ties.

title: Why will millions in US face wage garnishment after May 5?
content: Starting May 5th, the Education Department will resume collecting defaulted federal student loans, ending the pandemic-era freeze. Millions of borrowers risk wage garnishment and seized tax refunds, impacting 5.3 million currently in default and 4 million nearing it. Critics argue this move will harm struggling families amidst policy confusion and uncertainty surrounding repayment plans.

title: Pope Francis wanted a humble tomb at Rome’s St Mary Major Basilica
content: Pope Francis, who passed away at 88, expressed his wish to be buried in the Papal Basilica of St Mary Major, deviating from the traditional papal burial site. His will, released by the Vatican, revealed a desire for a simple tomb with the inscription "Franciscus.

title: US markets in bear zone? Trade policies & rising Treasury yields - top signs
content: US stock markets are facing a potential bear territory amid escalating trade tensions with China and President Trump's criticism of the Federal Reserve. Rising Treasury yields and a weakening dollar are adding to economic uncertainty, prompting investors to reconsider strategies.

title: 'Unlawful': Harvard files lawsuit to pause Trump’s $2.2 billion funding freeze
content: Harvard University has filed a lawsuit against the Trump administration, challenging the freeze on over $2.2 billion in federal funding. The university argues that the funding freeze is unlawful and exceeds the government's authority. The lawsuit, filed in a Massachusetts federal court, claims the administration is attempting to control academic decision-making, violating the First Amendment and other federal laws.

title: 'Justice will be served': FBI boss Kash Patel hails Harpreet Singh's arrest in US
content: FBI chief Kash Patel announced the arrest of Harpreet Singh in Sacramento, wanted in India for multiple terror attacks in Punjab. The FBI coordinated with Indian authorities, ensuring Singh will face justice. Singh, linked to the Babbar Khalsa International, is accused of planning attacks and providing support for terrorist activities, including the 2024 Chandigarh grenade attack.

title: Watchdog sues to preserve Trump officials' Signal chats after Hegseth leak
content: American Oversight has broadened its lawsuit against Trump administration officials, demanding the preservation of Signal app messages. This follows reports of Pete Hegseth sharing Yemen military strike details via Signal, raising concerns about federal record-keeping violations. The lawsuit targets officials like Ratcliffe and Gabbard.

title: IPL match today, LSG vs DC
content: Lucknow Super Giants, led by Rishabh Pant, will face Axar Patel's Delhi Capitals in a crucial IPL match. While DC sits second with five wins, LSG is fifth. Pant's poor form is a concern for Lucknow, while Axar's bowling struggles worry Delhi. Lucknow's home games on red soil have resulted in losses, adding pressure.

title: We're accused of intruding into Parliament's domain, says SC
content: The Supreme Court, facing criticism for setting a time limit for the President on bills, appeared hesitant regarding a PIL seeking President's rule in West Bengal due to alleged attacks on Hindus. Justice Gavai expressed concern about the court being accused of overreach.

title: Watch: Trump mocks Biden’s Easter Bunny moment, says ‘I got a better bunny’
content: During the White House Easter Egg Roll, President Donald Trump poked fun at a 2022 incident involving former President Joe Biden and an aide dressed as the Easter Bunny. Trump referenced the viral clip where the Easter Bunny steered Biden away from reporters during a conversation about foreign policy.

title: 'What a ridiculous situation': Trump lashes out at courts over immigration delays
content: Donald Trump has criticised the US judicial system, including the Supreme Court, for allegedly obstructing his efforts to deport undocumented immigrants, including those he labelled as violent criminals and terrorists. Trump claimed the courts were reluctant to allow deportations, particularly to countries like Venezuela.

title: Russia open to peace talks? Putin proposes bilateral 'negotiations'
content: Amidst ongoing conflict, Russian President Vladimir Putin has signaled a readiness for direct peace talks with Ukraine, a shift welcomed by Washington. This comes after a brief Easter ceasefire, marred by mutual accusations of violations. Ukraine's President Zelenskyy, while skeptical, is sending a delegation to London for discussions with Western allies.

title: PM Modi, JD Vance lay roadmap for trade talks, welcome progress
content: PM Modi and US Vice President J.D. Vance hailed the progress in negotiations for a mutually beneficial bilateral trade agreement (BTA), emphasizing its focus on citizen welfare. The US formally announced the terms of reference, outlining a roadmap for discussions on shared economic priorities.

title: Larkin expresses disappointment with Detroit Red Wings' invisible trade deadline
content: The Detroit Red Wings stood idle at this trade deadline, and Dylan Larkin called out the management leaving the team spirit wasted. Missing the playoffs for the ninth consecutive year, management was hardly going in on the action unlike competition Ottawa was competing against for a position in rebuilding. It was further evident in the team's sixth-place finish in the Atlantic Division.

title: Wife arrested for Karnataka ex-DGP's murder; son says she threatened him
content: Pallavi, the 64-year-old wife of retired Karnataka DGP Om Prakash, was arrested for his murder after confessing to stabbing him multiple times. Their son, Karthikesh, suspected his mother and sister of conspiracy, alleging Pallavi had been threatening Prakash for a week, prompting him to temporarily move out. Kriti convinced Prakash to return home before the fatal incident.

title: 'Jaat' box office collection: Sunny Deol film holds well, nears Rs 75 crore
content: Sunny Deol's 'Jaat' faced controversy over religious sentiments, leading to scene removal. Despite this, it grossed ₹76.26 crore, with ₹1.86 crore on its second Monday. 'Jaat' earned ₹61.75 crore in its first week. Akshay Kumar's 'Kesari 2' posed tough competition, opening at ₹7.5 crore and earning ₹4.59 crore on its first Monday, impacting 'Jaat's' performance.

title: Watch: Delta Air Lines plane catches fire at Orlando airport
content: A Delta Air Lines flight 1213, bound for an undisclosed location, experienced an engine fire at Orlando International Airport before takeoff on Monday. Prompt evacuation of all 282 passengers, 10 flight attendants, and two pilots was conducted with no reported injuries. Aircraft Rescue & Fire Fighting team responded swiftly.

title: Baba Siddique's son Zeeshan Siddique gets a death threat
content: Following the assassination of Baba Siddique in Mumbai, his son Zeeshan Siddique has received a death threat via email, demanding a ransom of Rs 10 crore. The threat, purportedly from the D company, warns Zeeshan will meet the same fate as his father if the ransom isn't paid.

title: IPL: Gill-Sudharsan stand sets up GT's win as KKR falter on slow Eden track
content: Gujarat Titans defeated Kolkata Knight Riders by 39 runs, propelled by a strong 114-run opening partnership between Shubman Gill (90) and Sai Sudharsan (52). KKR struggled to chase the 199-run target, managing only 159/8, with Ajinkya Rahane's 50 being the lone bright spot. GT's spinners, led by Rashid Khan, effectively stifled KKR's batting lineup, securing a comfortable victory.

title: In big breakthrough, Isro docks 2 SpaDeX satellites for 2nd time
content: Isro has achieved a second successful docking of its SpaDeX satellites, marking a significant advancement in space technology. Chairman V Narayanan hailed the operation as smooth, emphasizing its importance for future missions. Union Minister Jitendra Singh announced the docking, following the initial docking on January 16 and subsequent undocking on March 13.

title: Teachers clash with cops as Bengal fails to publish list of the ‘untainted’
content: The West Bengal School Service Commission (SSC) failed to meet its deadline for releasing lists of teachers categorized as "tainted" and "untainted," sparking protests and clashes with police outside its headquarters. A new "cut-off" was introduced, validating only the initial three counseling rounds from 2017-2019, leading to a standoff and barricading of the SSC office.

title: Missing original caste census report troubles Karnataka government
content: A political firestorm has erupted in Karnataka over the missing original caste census report prepared by the Kantharaj Commission. Opposition parties are fiercely criticizing the government for relying on a revised report based on sample data, raising concerns about the authenticity and transparency of the entire exercise. Questions arise about the validity of policy decisions based on this revised report.

title: Sacked Maharashtra cop gets life for killing API, chopping up body
content: Abhay Kurundkar, a dismissed police inspector, received a life sentence for the 2016 murder of assistant police inspector Ashwini Bidre-Gore, even though her body was never recovered. A Panvel court criticized the Navi Mumbai police for their delayed response and implicated two officers for investigative lapses. Two accomplices received seven-year sentences for assisting in the body's disposal.

title: Dialysis most availed of treatment under PMJAY
content: Under Ayushman Bharat-PM Jan Arogya Yojana, dialysis has become the most availed treatment, benefiting over 64 lakh patients in the last six years. Tamil Nadu leads with 7.3 lakh dialysis cycles, followed by Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat.

title: Pistons snap historic 15-game playoff drought as Towns has quiet night for Knicks
content: Cade Cunningham and the Detroit Pistons are back in their series against the no. 3 new york Knicks after hanging onto a Game 2 win at Madison Square Garden . the other two East series will pick back up Wednesday . here's what matters most and what to expect from the playoffs .

title: European soccer review: Real Madrid still in title race, plus much more
content: the laLiga title race is nearly officially over, but the race for european places is as competitive as ever . in the Bundesliga, Germany's last remaining clubs were knocked out of european competition, but Bayern Munich returned to some sense of normalcy by dismantling a relative minnow .

title: Elderly travel up to 44 kilometres to get hospitalised: Study

title: Morning news wrap: PM Modi emplanes for Jeddah, Harvard sues Trump admin, and more
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: College baseball Week 10: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: we're getting down to crunch time for some teams to prove themselves . the biggest riser was Vanderbilt, which jumped up 10 spots after sweeping Georgia . Ole Miss dropped 12 spots to no. 23 in the ranking this week after losing a road series to south Carolina .

title: These 4 Indian Cardinals Will Be In Conclave That Picks Next Pope
content: Following the death of the Pope, the Vatican will enter a nine-day mourning period known as the Novendiale, an ancient Roman tradition that continues to this day. During this time, preparations will begin for the election of the next Pontiff.

title: JD Vance In Jaipur Today, Welcome By Elephants, Amer Fort Visit Lined Up
content: US Vice President J D Vance, who is on a four-day India visit, reached Jaipur along with his family on Monday night and is set to visit the Amber Fort--a UNESCO World Heritage Site-- on Tuesday.

title: Actor Mahesh Babu Summoned In Money Laundering Case Linked To Realty Firms
content: The Enforcement Directorate has summoned popular actor Ghattamaneni Mahesh Babu in a money laundering case linked to realty groups Surana Group and Sai Surya Developers. The agency has asked Mr Babu to appear for an inquiry on Sunday.

title: Indian-Origin MP's Message To Hindus, Sikhs In Canada After Temple Vandalism
content: A temple was defaced by vandals in Canada's Surrey with pro-Khalistan graffiti, marking another incident targeting religious institutions in the North American nation.

title: In 100 Days Of Office, Trump Shatters US Global Role
content: Trump, showing a distaste for soft power, has killed more than 80 percent of US overseas assistance and has eyed major cuts in diplomatic staff in Africa.

title: Twist In Air Force Officer's Assault Case In Bengaluru, New Video Emerges
content: An Indian Air Force officer was assaulted, and his wife, also an officer in the air force, was verbally abused by a man in Bengaluru yesterday.

title: India-Saudi Arabia Ties Have Acquired Strategic Depth, Momentum: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Tuesday said India deeply values its long and historic ties with Saudi Arabia, asserting that their relations have acquired a strategic depth and momentum in recent years.

title: Live Updates: JD Vance On Jaipur Tour Today, To Visit Amer Fort, Hawa Mahal
content: JD Vance will deliver a speech at the Rajasthan International Centre before holding some meetings with political and business leaders.

title: PM Modi To Visit Saudi Arabia, First PM To Visit Jeddah In 40 Years
content: India and Saudi Arabia are set to sign at least six memoranda of understanding (MoUs) on Tuesday during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Jeddah, with talks ongoing late Monday to finalise a few more agreements, according to sources.

title: Guard Stops Car 'Without Sticker' At Noida Complex. Then This Happened
content: According to officials, the security guards posted at the main gate of the residential complex stopped a resident's SUV because it did not have a sticker on it.

title: Hindu Temple "Vandalised" With Pro-Khalistan Graffiti In Canada
content: A temple in Canada's Surrey has been defaced by vandals with pro-Khalistan graffiti at its entrance and the pillars, authorities said.

title: Father, Son Fake Kidnapping To Avoid Repaying Borrowed Money: UP Police
content: A man allegedly hatched a fake kidnapping plot here with the help of his son to avoid repaying borrowed money, police said on Monday, adding that the duo was arrested from Jaipur.

title: White House Looking To Replace Pentagon Chief After Chat Leak Row: Report
content: The White House has started a process to look for a new Pentagon chief, a US broadcaster said, following media reports that Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth shared sensitive military information in a group chat that included his wife and brother.

title: Indian To Be Charged For Molesting Cabin Crew On Singapore-Bound Plane
content: A 20-year-old Indian national will be charged in Singapore on Tuesday for allegedly outraging the modesty of a cabin crew member aboard an aircraft bound for the city-state.

title: Chat Blunder Deepens, Pentagon Ex-Official Flags "Meltdown", Trump Responds
content: US President Donald Trump defended his Defence Secretary, Pete Hegseth, following reports of the Pentagon chief disclosing sensitive military information in a second Signal chatroom with his family members and other staffers.

title: Sharp Escalation In Trump vs Harvard, Lawsuit Flags Serious Violations
content: Harvard sued US President Donald Trump's administration Monday in a sharp escalation of the fight between the prestigious university and the Republican, who has threatened its funding and sought to impose outside political supervision.

title: JNUSU polls to be called off? Panel seeks cop cover

title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman meets business leaders in San Francisco
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, who is on a 11-day trip to the U.S. and Peru,discusses bilateral cooperation, investment opportunities with business leaders in San Franciso.

title: ‘Mohammed bin Salman a strong advocate of bilateral ties’, says PM Modi in interview
content: PM Modi praises Saudi Crown Prince as a strong advocate of bilateral ties and invites Saudi companies to invest in India

title: Kerala government declares three-day State mourning as a mark of respect for Pope Francis
content: Decision follows Union Ministry of Home Affairs’ letter to State governments declaring a period of national mourning

title: Pope Francis maintained close ties with Church in India
content: He strived to find solution to a long simmering dispute over Mass liturgy in the Ernakulam-Angamaly archdiocese

title: PM Modi’s Saudi trip | Nations to ink 6 pacts, PM to discuss Hajj quota with Crown Prince
content: Mr. Modi is on a two-day trip to Saudi Arabia at the invitation of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, and it will mark the first visit by an Indian Prime Minister in 40 years to Jeddah.

title: Judiciary’s place atop the pyramid
content: The Vice-President’s recent criticism of the judiciary has received a mixed response, but complaints about it’s lack of transparency and accountability — apprehensions also shared by the public — need to be addressed appropriately

title: Why did China block exports of rare earth elements?
content: What are rare earth elements? Why did China restrict their imports? How do the restrictions impact India?

title: Censoring change: How Bollywood’s elite resist caste-conscious cinema
content: Phule seems to be the latest among the long line of alternative movies that have faced significant hurdles on the way to the big screen, simply for exploring Dalit-Bahujan identities and narratives that mainstream Hindi cinema has often shied away from; and it’s not without a pattern it seems

title: Government imposes 12% safeguard duty on certain steel products for 200 days
content: While some big domestic steel makers advocate for duty imposition, the user industry is strongly against it as it would push raw material prices, impacting their competitiveness

title: Contrary to expectations, Karnataka’s mango yield drops again due to harsh weather
content: The farmers have not seen a profitable year for a long time now, at least four to five years. This year, the flowering was not good due to temperature of around 33 to 34 degrees Celsius

title: India announces three-day state mourning on passing of Pope Francis
content: During the period of the state mourning, the national flag will be flown at half mast throughout India on all buildings where the national flag is flown regularly and there will be no official entertainment

title: "You'll Be Killed Like Your Father": Baba Siddique's Son Gets Death Threat
content: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader and Baba Siddique's son Zeeshan Siddique has received a death threat via email, said police officials on Monday.

title: "Deeply Saddening": Yogi Adityanath Condoles Demise Of Pope Francis
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has expressed condolences on the demise of Pope Francis.

title: Australia Election: PM Albanese's Party Holds Slim Lead As Voting Begins
content: Early voting in the Australian election began on Tuesday, with Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's centre-left Labor party holding a slim lead over the conservative opposition coalition.

title: Forest Guard Thrashed For Attempting To Rape Minor In Rajasthan: Cops
content: A forest guard of Ranthambore Tiger Reserve was caught while allegedly attempting to rape a minor girl and was roughened up by villagers in Sawai Madhopur district on Monday, police said.

title: Tribals are ‘biggest Hindus’, says Chhattisgarh Chief Minister; Baghel rebuts claims
content: As per the 2011 census, the share of tribals in Chhatisgarh’s population was 30.62% with the population concentrated in Sarguja and Bastar regions of North and South Chhattisgarh respectively

title: E-cigarette racket busted in Hyderabad; brothers held for peddling vapes to students
content: The deliveries were handled by courier services like DTDC and ride-hailing platforms such as Uber and Rapido, which may now find themselves in the dock for failing to screen parcels given to minors, said the Director of TGANB, Sandeep Shandilya.

title: Cruise operators commence at Mumbai International Cruise Terminal, India’s largest
content: Spread over a built-up area of over 4.15 lakh square feet, the MICT has been developed at Ballard Pier. The total investment in the MICT project is ₹556 crore

title: Petition dismissed after Nashik dargah withdraws it from the Supreme Court
content: The dargah was demolished by the municipal corporation a few days ago, hours before the apex court stayed its demolition

title: Calcutta University scholars travel to Sundarbans village to save language
content: They are translating into the English a novel about char lands, river erosion, loss of land, and the vulnerability of people’s life there, written by a local in a tribal language called Sadri

title: First stop Akshardham Temple for Vances, U.S. VP says his 'kids, in particular, loved it'
content: “A carved wooden elephant, a model of the Delhi Akshardham Temple and children’s books were gifted to the family”

title: Sainthoods, Cardinal elevation: a papacy marked by a keen engagement with India
content: Francis, who was the first non-European Pope in nearly 1,300 years, died on Easter Monday. He was 88. The Pope was diagnosed with double pneumonia

title: ‘Wasn’t consulted’: Maharashtra language panel chief on Hindi row
content: The committee has already written a letter to Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis advising to revoke the decision

title: HCA cannot take any financial decisions: HC interim direction
content: The interim direction was passed in a writ petition filed by the Telangana Cricket Association, levelling serious allegations against HCA, accusing its office bearers of indulging in corruption

title: SNDP: 13 components from Phase-I remain non-starters within and outside Hyderabad
content: Officials cite various reasons ranging from lack of right of way and difficulties in utility shifting

title: W.B. school recruitment crisis: fresh protests erupt outside WBSSC office over demand of list of ‘tainted’ and ‘untainted’ candidates
content: Hundreds of teachers laid siege to the Commission’s office, demanding the immediate publication of the list and the resignation of the Education Minister and the WBSSC Chairperson, after the agency missed the promised deadline.

title: Final-year IIT Kharagpur student found dead in hostel
content: Following the second unnatural student death at IIT Kharagpur this year, the Institute’s Teachers’ Association is demanding the immediate appointment of a permanent director.

title: First consignment of organic compost from Brahmapuram to Dubai flagged off
content: The compost, produced through an eco-friendly process using Black Soldier Fly (BSF) larvae, is being exported to the Dubai-based SSK Blending LLC for their vertical farming initiatives.

title: Two linked with father-son murder in Murshidabad arrested in Odisha
content: Six other Murshidabad men who had allegedly participated in the violence during the protests against the Waqf Act were detained in Jharsuguda

title: ED carrying on vendetta against Congress: Chidambaram on National Herald case
content: Congress leader P. Chidambaram said there was no case since there was no transaction of money and, therefore, no proceeds of crime nor any money laundering.

title: Prashant Kishor demands White Paper on caste-based survey; ‘unfulfilled promises’
content: Mr. Kishor asserted that states like Andhra Pradesh, which started their land survey after Bihar, have digitized 80% of the land so far, but Bihar has only digitized 20%.

title: National Herald case a political conspiracy: Kanhaiya Kumar
content: ‘No one is speaking about the finances of BJP and RSS. From where are they getting the money to build their plush offices in every city?’

title: Quraishi slams Dubey; says for some, religious identities are staple to forward hateful politics
content: Nishikant Dubey's barb at the former CEC came a day after his vitriolic attack on the Supreme Court and Chief Justice of Sanjiv Khanna, blaming the CJI for causing "civil wars" in India.

title: Gold was being smuggled to India after declaring it to be taken either to Geneva or Bangkok: DRI tells Karnataka High Court
content: Ranya was booking tickets both to Geneva or Bangkok but travelling to India without cancelling other ticket

title: Liquor scam: SIT police arrests Kasireddy Rajasekhar Reddy at RGIA airport in Hyderabad
content: A team of police are shifting Kasireddy to Vijayawada, and will produce him in the court, according to a senior police officer

title: Nature’s fury leaves behind trail of destruction in J&K’s Ramban
content: Authorities launch massive exercise, pressing into service men and machinery, to restore critical Srinagar-Jammu highway, which saw a major disruption; Jammu divisional commissioner says departments instructed to expedite restoration of water supply, power supply, and other public utilities

title: Private schools warned against conducting tests, interviews for students and parents for admission
content: Commissioner of Public Instruction in a circular says 50% seats should be mandatorily reserved for girls in all co-educational schools

title: BJP accuses Rahul Gandhi of being a ‘traitor’ over his remarks on EC
content: Slamming the former Congress president, BJP MP Sambit Patra says Mr. Gandhi is a ‘politically unfit person’ and that such an individual always ‘takes the crutches of false allegations’ to prove that he is a leader

title: SC junks students’ plea over attempts for JEE-Advanced 2025 exam
content: The plea claimed the petitioners were aggrieved by the "abrupt and arbitrary policy reversal" regarding the eligibility criteria for JEE-Advanced 2025 by the Joint Admission Board

title: PM Modi, U.S. Vice-President Vance see progress in bilateral trade talks
content: PM reviews ties with U.S. Vice-President, hosts his family for dinner; no mention of tariff and visa revocation issues in PMO statement; no new agreements announced as earlier expected

title: BJP’s Madhav Bhandari sparks controversy over 26/11 remarks, later issues clarification
content: In remarks that triggered widespread outrage, Bhandari claimed that the 26/11 Mumbai terror attack would not have been possible without the involvement of individuals who had influence over the local administration

title: Bihar Mahagathbandhan’s rank and file to meet
content: Coinciding with Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s Madhubani visit on April 24, the Opposition alliance’s leadership has planned a two-day meeting

title: Adityanath backing pro-monarchy movement in Nepal: CPN-Maoist-Centre’s Matrika Prasad Yadav
content: CPN-Maoist-Centre plans to arrest former king Gyanendra for supporting pro-monarchy protests, accusing UP CM of interference.

title: Civil services should get credit for smooth transfer of power: Cabinet Secretary
content: Cabinet Secretary T.V. Somanathan bats for lateral entry, says even corrupt IAS officers get high ranking in online appraisal system

title: FMGs’ worry grows as NEET PG exam application date nears
content: Permanent or Temporary Registration, which is mandatory for them to apply for the exam, has been elusive for them for various reasons

title: Traffic chaos near toll plazas ruins smooth Bengaluru–Mysuru highway experience
content: Many are calling for immediate action from NHAI, including better toll management, functional Fastag sensors, and contingency measures like opening gates during peak congestion to prevent further disruption.

title: EPFO adds 7.39 lakh new members in February
content: Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Gujarat, Haryana, Delhi, Telangana and Uttar Pradesh added more than 5% of the total net payroll during the month

title: Probe on into missing of POCSO case survivor, child from shelter home in Kozhikode
content: The girl and her child had recently been brought to Shakti Sadan, an integrated relief and rehabilitation home for women in distress

title: Farmers’ outfits raise call to burn effigies of Modi, Trump, Vance as mark of protest against trade treaty
content: U.S. wants unregulated access for its agribusiness corporations to operate in India and this will hit the peasants hard, says Samyukt Kisan Morcha

title: CISF takes over security at Aizawl airport
content: This will be the Central Industrial Security Force’s first unit stationed in Mizoram, and the 69th civilian airport under its protection

title: Nine days of mourning for Pope Francis, says Catholic Bishops’ Conference of India
content: CBCI and Chavara Cultural Centre Delhi organise condolence meeting that leaders from various faiths, diplomats, clergy, and public figures attend.

title: Telangana Rythu Mahotsavam in Nizamabad assures desilting of Nizamsagar and SRSP soon
content: Government was fully equipped for the ongoing Rabi 2024–25 paddy procurement, with all necessary infrastructure, in place across the State, says Minister for Irrigation

title: Kerala govt. hikes payment for daily wage and contract workers
content: Appointees will have to give an affidavit that he/she will not make any claims for regularisation of employment, as per norms issued by the Finance dept.

title: Anvar’s UDF entry hits roadblock amid resistance from allies
content: Front constituents are apparently willing to collaborate with the former MLA for the Nilambur byelection, but they are hesitant to formally include him in the front. They fear that a formal entry into the UDF will lend legitimacy to him and all his past deeds

title: Blasting row at Upper Sengulam power project: KSEB to seek advice from Central Institute of Mining and Fuel Research
content: Blasting operations for constructing a tunnel for the hydel project were halted on February 17 after local residents raised concerns regarding safety

title: Court to pronounce sentence in Ambalamukku Vineetha murder case on April 24; prosecution seeks death penalty
content: District Collector, District Police Chief state accused pose serious threat to society, shows minimal potential for reformation

title: Bihar Congress suspends party’s Buxar district president for poor turnout at Kharge’s rally
content: About 10,000 chairs had been arranged for the ‘Jai Bapu, Jai Bhim, Jai Samvidhan’ rally; a video of thousands of empty chairs went viral on social media; the Bihar Assembly election is due to be held later this year

title: Water samples test negative for contamination, situation monitored in Woraiyur, says Tiruchi Corporation
content: A total of 40 special health teams have been deployed in the affected areas to check and monitor the condition of the residents and 15 medical teams have set up camps in the area

title: Should KCR be remembered for pushing Telangana into ₹8 lakh crore debt, Congress asks KTR
content: People have rejected the BRS twice as people realised their misgovernance, only KCR’s family members were happy with the BRS rule, the Congress MP said
